content.rendered:
11 August 2015 – Offshore Wind Consultants Limited, part of Oslo-listed Aqualis ASA, expands its physical footprint and opens a new office in Hamburg, Germany.

The new Hamburg office will be used as the operating base for the company’s growing client and project work based in the region, and will also provide a base for other Aqualis Group services in this sector.

In 2014, renewable energy constituted 25.8 percent of the total electricity production in Germany, thereby becoming the country’s biggest energy source for the first time, according to the German Association of Energy and Water Industries (Bundesverband der Energie- und Wasserwirtschaft – BDEW).

Speaking of the new office development, Ian Bonnon, managing director of Offshore Wind Consultants, said: “The opening of our new office in Hamburg recognises the strategic importance of Germany in the offshore wind sector. We are delighted to have grown our business in a positive way which has allowed us to expand into Germany ahead of our planned global expansion plans. This is a major step forward for us and we look forward to a successful era of assisting investors, developers and owners deliver successful projects in the German sector.”

Offshore Wind Consultants is a globally focused consultancy providing independent services to the offshore renewables industry. It is one of the major players in the offshore wind consultancy business. The company was acquired by Aqualis ASA in June 2014.

Offshore Wind Consultants’ newly established German company will trade under the name of OWC (AQUALIS) GmbH.

excerpt.rendered: 11 August 2015 – Offshore Wind Consultants Limited, part of Oslo-listed Aqualis ASA, expands its physical footprint and opens a new office in Hamburg, Germany.

jetpack-related-posts.title: OWC expands offshore wind offering
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: Renewables consultancy firm OWC sets up its own energy yield assessment service capability for offshore wind projects, providing an additional integrated service offering to developers.

jetpack-related-posts.title: Offshore Wind Consultants rebrand to OWC
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: Offshore Wind Consultants Ltd, a wholly-owned subsidiary of AqualisBraemar ASA, is rebranding to a new name: OWC

jetpack-related-posts.title: UK offshore wind job for AqualisBraemar
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: 30 March 2016 – Offshore marine and engineering consultancy AqualisBraemar has been contracted by A2SEA to perform engineering consultancy services for its offshore wind farm installation work at the Race Bank Offshore Wind Farm offshore the UK. jetpack-related-posts.title: AqualisBraemar appoints new Vietnam office lead
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: AqualisBraemar has appointed Ray Haveron to lead the Vietnam office as General Director / Country Manager.
